Sorry,I didn`t answer sooner,I got distracted by the disturbing news about another guy being killed in Iraq.Ok the answer to the question is.The first time that Richard Petty went around a race track he was not in a race car,he was on one!Richard was 13years oldHis dad LeePetty raced on dirt tracks,and Richard and his brother Maurice helped in the pits.During a very muddy race Richard climbed up on the hood to clean the mud off the windshield.Lee was in a hurry to get back into the race,so as soon as he had enough gas he took off,he could not see the right side of the windshield for all the mud and thus could not see richard.Richard started screaming and banging on the windshield to get his dad to stop,instead even after noticing him on the hood Lee kept the pedal to the metal all the way around the track,with Richard hanging on for dear life.Lee finally went back into the pits and only slowed down enough for Richard to jump off into the mud,Lee then roared back onto the track and won the race!

Sorry,I didn`t answer sooner,I got distracted by the disturbing news about another guy being killed in Iraq.Ok the answer to the question is.The first time that Richard Petty went around a race track he was not in a race car,he was on one!Richard was 13years oldHis dad LeePetty raced on dirt tracks,and Richard and his brother Maurice helped in the pits.During a very muddy race Richard climbed up on the hood to clean the mud off the windshield.Lee was in a hurry to get back into the race,so as soon as he had enough gas he took off,he could not see the right side of the windshield for all the mud and thus could not see richard.Richard started screaming and banging on the windshield to get his dad to stop,instead even after noticing him on the hood Lee kept the pedal to the metal all the way around the track,with Richard hanging on for dear life.Lee finally went back into the pits and only slowed down enough for Richard to jump off into the mud,Lee then roared back onto the track and won the race!

Ok,times up.When applying the boards to the deck surface it is always best to look at the end of the board at the earth or age rings.Then place the boards with the arch up in the center,That way,as the boards age,if they begin to cup ,the center of the board will start lifting instead of the edges.

 Next question,How many different kinds of rocks are there?

 
 Far too many to have a concrete (pun intended) answer. There are 3 main types, but many different rocks in each group. Also, consider that there are completely different types of rock found on other planets, which sometimes get to earth through aid of astroids or comets. There are most likely many more types of rocks located deep within the earth that we may never be able to reach, so the number would be tenuous at best.

 I know this thread started with a request not to use search engines, but this is not a common knowledge question.
 
 empty 80715 tons = 2.518,408.7364 cubic feet = 18.829,005.6616 gallons
 full 103487 tons = 3.228,923.5569 cubic feet = 24,154,025.6314 gallons

Everybody has heard of the Ford Rouge plant,but when Henry Ford first bought the land that the plant is on,he was thinking about turning that land into what?
In 1915 Henry Ford bought 2000 acres along the Rouge River west of Detroit, intending to use the site only to make coke, smelt iron, and build tractors. 
 
 It was used to make boats for a while, then the Highland Park assembly line was moved there and the production switched to Model A Fords.

 What was the shortest war in history?

 Let's change course:
 What was the shortest war in history?

 
 Shortest War
 British ships bombed the island of Zanzibar at 
 9 am on August 27, 1896. At 9.45 am Zanzibar surrendered, after the shortest war in history. Germany and Britain had been engaged in territorial disputes over the small island of Zanzibar, off the east African coast, for several years. During the late 1880s and early 1890s, the island had gradually come under British control. Throughout this time the Sultan of Zanzibar obediently carried out British commands. When the Sultan died in 1896, however, his second son seized the throne and, with German support, he declared himself the new Sultan. The British feared their German rivals would come to dominate Zanzibar and so they ordered the new Sultan to retire - or face the consequences. The Sultan refused to withdraw his claim to the throne. Instead he assembled 2,500 Arab soldiers
